greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of distinct 8th powers modulo n.
comment: This sequence is multiplicative. - Leon P Smith, Apr 16 2005
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
S. Li, On the number of elements with maximal order in the multiplicative group modulo n, Acta Arithm. 86 (2) (1998) 113, see proof of theorem 2.1
R. J. Mathar, Size of the set of residues of integer powers of fixed exponent, (2017).
mathematica: a[n_] := Table[PowerMod[i, 8, n], {i, 0, n - 1}] // Union // Length;
program: (PARI) a(n)=my(f=factor(n)); prod(i=1, #f[, 1], my(k=f[i, 1]^f[i, 2]); #vecsort(vector(k, i, i^8%k), , 8)) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 05 2013
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Jun 27 2003
